intro: Eugeniopsis richardiana, commonly known as the Richard's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
